main_definition: Charms can refer to the magical qualities attributed to objects or individuals, as well as a person's ability to attract others through their charm and appeal.

meanings_and_examples.example: She wore her grandmother's old amulet that was said to have charms protecting against evil spirits.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The ability to attract or enchant others
meanings_and_examples.example: His charm and wit made him very popular among his peers, often referred to as having a natural charming personality.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A decorative item with ornamental features
meanings_and_examples.example: The necklace she wore was adorned with intricate charms representing different aspects of her life and interests.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To influence or persuade someone positively
meanings_and_examples.example: By sharing his personal experiences, he charmed the audience into believing in his vision for change.
